capstone.utility

Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • capstone.utility.AbstractPair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>
      • capstone.utility.Point
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Point>

    public class Point
extends AbstractPair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>
implements java.lang.Comparable<Point>
    A Point in a coordinate system. Note that the y component is measured in rows, i.e. it increases when going down. Also note that a point may never be negative, either for x or for y components.

    • Field Summary

      • Point

        public Point(java.lang.String string)
        Convenience constructor to construct a Point from a string representation. The string must contain two numbers separated by one or more non-digit characters, e.g.: (1, 2) 1, 2 1 2 1, 2 [1, 2]
        Parameters:
        string - The string representing the point.

      • move

        public Point move(int dx,
                  int dy)
        Moves the point by the specified delta-x and delta-y.
        Parameters:
        dx - How much to move the x-component of the point by.
        dy - How much to move the y-component of the point by.
        Returns:
        The resulting point (this).

        public Point move(Delta delta)
        Moves the point by the specified Delta.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The resulting point (this).

      • wouldGoNegative

        public boolean wouldGoNegative(Delta delta)
        Tests if the point would go negative if the delta were applied. This method exists to keep the constraint tight that a point must never be negative.
        Parameters:
        delta - The Delta to test.
        Returns:
        True if applying the delta to the point would make it go negative on either or both components, else false if the point would remain valid.

      • wouldGoNegative

        public boolean wouldGoNegative(int dx,
                               int dy)
        Tests if the point would go negative if it was moved by the specified delta-x and delta-y were applied. This method exists to keep the constraint tight that a point must never be negative.
        Parameters:
        dx - The delta-x to test for.
        dy - The delta-y to test for.
        Returns:
        True if applying the delta-x and delta-y to the point would make it go negative on either or both components, else false if the point would remain valid.

      • wouldGoOutside

        public boolean wouldGoOutside(Delta delta,
                              Region region)
        Tests if applying the Delta would cause the Point to move outside the region.
        Parameters:
        delta - The Delta to test for.
        region - The region to test for.
        Returns:
        True if applying the Delta to the Point would cause it to trespass the boundaries of the Region, else false if it would be within the Region.

      • distanceTo

        public Delta distanceTo(Point other)
        Returns the distance to another Point, as a Delta object.
        Parameters:
        other - The other Point.
        Returns:
        The Delta either Point would have to travel to reach the respective other point.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Point other)
        Compares two Points by their x, then y-coordinates.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Point>
        Parameters:
        other - The Point to compare-to.
        Returns:
        +1 if this Point's x coordinate is greater than that of the other point, -1 if it is less. If it is equal, the same comparison is performed on the y-coordinate. If both coordinates are equal, the whole Point is equal.
